page.title: 03THE CASTLE 1
page.content: The castle was built by William de Mohun who was given Dunster and other land after the Norman lnvasion. Nothing remains of this first castle. The oldest part of the castle still standing today is the 13th century gateway to the outer bailey. In 1138, a stone castle was made with a keep gatehouse, domestic buildings and an outside wall. More buildings were added over the years and when it was sold in 1376 by Lady Joan de Mohun to Lady Elizabeth Luttrell it must have been a fine castle. The castle continued to belong to the Luttrell family until this century. By the middle of the 16th century, the keep buildings on the top of the tor had become broken down and in 1617 plans for a new house in the lower level were drawn up. A lot of this building still stands today but it was
